https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/e.description: UPC (aka UPC-A) consists of 12 numeric digits that are uniquely assigned to each trade item. Along with the related EAN barcode, the UPC is the barcode mainly used for scanning of trade items at the point of sale, per GS1 specifications.

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: Generally used to capture location-related data, also for locations without UN Location Codes.

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: Date when the transport document has been issued

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Date when the last container that is linked to the transport document is physically loaded onboard the vessel indicated on the transport document.

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.title: Received For Shipment Date
https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: Date when the last container linked to the transport document is physically in the terminal (customers cleared against the intended vessel).

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Cargo Movement Type At Origin
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Refers to the shipment term at the loading of the cargo into the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Cargo Movement Type At Destination
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Refers to the shipment term at the unloading of the cargo out of the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Receipt Delivery Type At Origin
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Origin. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Receipt Delivery Type At Destination
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Destination. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Service Contract Reference
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Reference number for agreement between shipper and carrier through which the shipper commits to provide a certain minimum quantity of cargo over a fixed period, and the carrier commits to a certain rate or rate schedule.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Shipping Instruction

The shipping instruction includes volume or weight, cargo items, shipping dates, origin, destination, and other special instructions. The information given by the shipper through the shipping instruction is the information required to create a Transport Document.

examples: Product number of registering Legal Entity such as an ISBN (required)

model.title: Model of the product

material.title: Material the product is made from
examples: Material the product is made from, could be specified as 'composites' (required)

weight.title: Weight of the product

height.title: Height of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

width.title: Width of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

depth.title: Depth of the Product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

url.title: Url or the product item
examples: URL of the product; could be empty (required)

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.title: Transport Equipment
https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: A piece of equipment used to hold, protect or secure cargo for transportation purposes.

https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.title: Equipment Reference
https://service.unece.org/trade/uncefact.description: The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible. According to ISO 6346, a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number (composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit). If a container does not comply with ISO 6346, it is suggested to follow Recommendation #2 Container with non-ISO identification from SMDG.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: ISO Equipment Code
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: Unique code for the different equipment size/type used for transporting commodities. The code is a concatenation of ISO Equipment Size Code and ISO Equipment Type Code A and follows the ISO 6346 standard.

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Tare Weight
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: The weight of an empty container (gross container weight).

https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.title: Weight Unit
https://api.swaggerhub.com/domains/dcsao.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

https://w3id.org/traceability#USMCACerti.title: USMCA Certificate Of Origin
https://w3id.org/traceability#USMCACerti.description: The new United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) allows importers to complete a certification of origin to include nine required data elements as well as a certification statement. These data elements do not need to follow a prescribed format. The USMCA also allows a certification of origin to be completed and signed with an electronic or digital signature.

https://w3id.org/traceability#certifier.title: Certifier
https://w3id.org/traceability#certifier.description: Importer, Exporter, or Producer Certification of Origin: Indicate whether the certifier is the exporter, producer, or importer in accordance with Chapter 5, Article 5.2 (Claims for Preferential Tariff Treatment) of the agreement.

https://w3id.org/traceability#exporterDe.title: Exporter's Details
https://w3id.org/traceability#exporterDe.description: Exporters name, address (including country), email address, and telephone number, if different than the certifier. This information is not required if the producer is completing the Certification of Origin and does not know the identity of the exporter. The address of the exporter shall be the place of export of the good in a Partys territory.

https://schema.org/manufacturer.title: Producer's Details
https://schema.org/manufacturer.description: Producers name, address (including country), email address, and telephone number, if different than the certifier or exporter, or, if there are multiple producers, state 'Various' or provide a list of producers. A person that wants this information to remain confidential may state 'Available upon request by the importing authorities.' The address of a producer shall be the place of production of the good in a Party's territory.

https://w3id.org/traceability#producerCo.title: Producer Confidential
https://w3id.org/traceability#producerCo.description: A person that wants the producer information to remain confidential may state 'Available upon request by the importing authorities.'

https://w3id.org/traceability#importerDe.title: Importer's Details
https://w3id.org/traceability#importerDe.description: Importers name, address, email address, and telephone number (if known). The address of the importer shall be in a Party's territory. If the identity of the importer is unknown, or there are various importers, please check the appropriate box.

https://w3id.org/traceability#importerUn.title: Importer Unknown
https://w3id.org/traceability#importerUn.description: If the identity of the importer is unknown, or there are various importers, please check the appropriate box.

https://schema.org/itemShipped.title: Description of goods
https://schema.org/itemShipped.description: Full description for each good, sufficient to relate it to the invoice description and the Harmonized System (HS) description of the goods.

https://schema.org/validFrom.title: Blanket Period From
https://schema.org/validFrom.description: The date upon which the certification becomes applicable to the good covered by the blanket Certification (it may be prior to the date of signing this certification).

https://schema.org/validThrough.title: Blanket Period To
https://schema.org/validThrough.description: The date upon which the blanket period expires. In no instance should that certification exceed a 12-month period, and any information provided should be updated in the event any previously-issued certification no longer applies.

https://schema.org/Product.title: Product
https://schema.org/Product.description: Product details. USMCA mandatory elements include: part/SKU number, description, and minimum 6-digit HS classification

https://w3id.org/traceability#originCrit.title: Origin Criterion
https://w3id.org/traceability#originCrit.description: Specify the Origin Criterion under which the good qualifies, as set out in Chapter 4, Article 4.2 (Originating Goods) of the USMCA/T-MEC/CUSMA agreement (https://ustr.gov/sites/default/files/files/agreements/FTA/USMCA/Text/04-Rules-of-Origin.pdf). Criterion A: The good is wholly obtained or produced entirely in the territory of one or more of the USMCA/T-MEC/CUSMA countries, as defined in Article 4.3 of the Agreement; Criterion B: The good is produced entirely in the territory of one or more of the USMCA/T-MEC/CUSMA countries using non-originating materials, provided the good satisfies all applicable requirements of product-specific rules of origin; Criterion C: The good is produced entirely in the territory of one or more of the USMCA/T-MEC/CUSMA countries exclusively from originating materials; or Criterion D: The good is produced entirely in the territory of one or more of the USMCA/T-MEC/CUSMA countries. It is classified with its materials, or satisfies the 'unassembled goods' requirement, and meets a regional value content threshold of not less than 60% if the transaction value method is used, or not less than 50% if the net cost method is used (not including RVC for autos); except for goods in Chapter 61-63 of the HTS.

https://w3id.org/traceability#countryOfO.title: Country of Origin
https://w3id.org/traceability#countryOfO.description: Identify the 2-digit ISO country code of the country of production for each good listed in this certification.
